articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Pro adresaci konkrétního git commitu se často používá zkrácená verze SHA-1 otisku. Vývojáři Linuxu při odkazování na opravovaný commit (Fixes:) používají prvních 12 znaků. Ukazuje se, že už to nemusí stačit. Kees Cook demonstrativně vytvořil 12 znakovou kolizi s počátečním commitem Linuxu (1da177e4c3f4 vs. 1da177e4c3f4). Trvalo mu to 6 hodin na GPU RTX 3080.
articles.title: 12 znaková kolize s počátečním commitem Linuxu

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán LineageOS 22. LineageOS (Wikipedie) je svobodný operační systém pro chytré telefony, tablety a set-top boxy založený na Androidu. Jedná se o nástupce CyanogenModu. LineageOS 22 je založený na Androidu 15.
articles.title: LineageOS 22

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Cloudflare na svém blogu představila nástroj příkazového řádku a knihovnu h3i pro nízkoúrovňové testování a ladění HTTP/3.
articles.title: h3i, nástroj příkazového řádku a knihovna pro nízkoúrovňové testování a ladění HTTP/3

articles.author: ZCR
articles.description: Český LibreOffice tým vydává překlad příručky Začínáme s LibreOffice 24.8. Tato příručka je určena pro uživatele, kteří nikdy předtím nepoužívali LibreOffice, nebo se chtějí seznámit se všemi částmi balíku. Cennou může být pro všechny uživatele, kteří se chtějí rychle seznámit s LibreOffice, ať už mají zkušenosti s jiným kancelářským softwarem, nebo nemají žádné. Příručka je ke stažení na stránce dokumentace.
articles.title: Český překlad příručky Začínáme s LibreOffice 24.8

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the Intel Graphics Compiler having dropped Ice Lake and older support and in turn the Intel Compute Runtime dropping Ice Lake and older to just focus on newer Intel graphics hardware support, Fedora packagers and other stakeholders have been grappling with how to handle the situation. For Fedora 42 there's been a proposal for updating to the newer Intel Compute Runtime code for benefiting the more recent Intel graphics hardware while in recent days there's been talk of forking the legacy code...
articles.title: Fedora Stakeholders Talk Of Forking Intel's Compute Runtime To Maintain Older Hardware

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With 2024 in the books, here is a look back at the most popular Linux hardware reviews and benchmark articles for 2024. In addition to the three thousand original Linux/open-source news articles last year, there was 191 Linux hardware reviews / multi-page benchmark articles written by myself. AMD Zen 5 on Linux easily dominated the list of most popular articles for the year along with ZLUDA and several of the Intel Arrow Lake and Granite Rapids articles plus the Framework 16 laptop...
articles.title: AMD Zen 5 Captivated Linux Reader Interest In 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last month I wrote about a Lenovo Legion Linux driver being posted for enabling more power/performance settings under Linux. Following a significant rework, a second iteration of those patches have now been posted with just being referred to as the Lenovo "Gaming Series" WMI drivers without the Legion reference...
articles.title: Lenovo Gaming Series WMI Drivers Updated For Enabling Extra Functionality Under Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For the Qualcomm Adreno X1-85 GPU found within the Snapdragon X1 series of laptop chips, an Adaptive Clock Distribution "ACD" feature is currently being wired up to the open-source MSM kernel driver to help with power and performance...
articles.title: ACD Power/Performance Feature Being Worked On For The GPU Within The Snapdragon X1

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Within the mainline Linux kernel has been the open-source SteelSeries HID driver while newly posted patches are tacking on support for the SteelSeries Arctis 9 wireless gaming headset...
articles.title: Linux "steelseries" Driver Being Extended For The SteelSeries Arctis 9 Wireless Headset

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Valve has just published the Steam Survey results for December 2024 and they reflect a nice upward trend for the Linux gaming statistics and a high point in recent times...
articles.title: Steam On Linux Ends 2024 With A Nice Boost To Its Marketshare, AMD Linux CPU Use At 74%

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the recent Serpent OS alpha builds for this original Linux distribution led by well known developer Ikey Doherty, the project has now outlined both some of their short term and longer term plans for this from-scratch Linux platform...
articles.title: Serpent OS To Explore Offline Rollbacks & Tools As A Service

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: To much surprise, the X.Org Server Git tree saw the most commits in 2024 going all the way back to 2014... While there were many more commits than in years prior, it's not a sign of resurgence for the X.Org Server with Wayland continuing to become the dominant force on the Linux desktop...
articles.title: X.Org Server Development Hit A Decade High For The Number Of Commits In 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mere hours into 2025 and some news I didn't expect to be writing about... An Oracle engineer has posted a set of patches implementing an ALGOL 68 programming language front-end for the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC). These are work-in-progress patches for the half century old niche programming language...
articles.title: GCC Patches Posted For Half-Century Old ALGOL 68 Programming Language

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: During the course of 2024 there were 3,021 original news articles written on Phoronix around Linux and open-source topics... Fresh content each and every day, 99% of which was written by your's truly. It was quite an eventful year with a lot of excitement in kernel space, hardware vendors continuing to ramp up timely new hardware support, the never-ending drive for maximum performance optimizations, the continued Rust-ification of the open-source world, and much more. Here is a look back at the most popular news on Phoronix over the past year...
articles.title: The Most Popular Linux & Open-Source News Of 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The hid-pidff driver exists within the Linux kernel for enabling force feedback "FF" support on various USB HID PID (Physical Interface Device) compliant devices. With a new set of patches posted yesterday, that hid-pidff driver is extended to "hid-universal-pidff" for supporting more functionality on quirky devices...
articles.title: Linux "hid-universal-pidff" Driver Proposed For Fixing More Quirky Devices

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Zlib-ng 2.2.3 is out as the "next gen" Zlib replacement led by Hans Kristian Rosbach that retains a Zlib-compatible API while also offering a modernized API, modern C11 syntax, support for more CPU intrinsics, and other leading-edge features compared to upstream Zlib...
articles.title: Zlib-ng 2.2.3 Rings In The New Year With ~17.8% Faster Inflate For AVX2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: RISC-V on the software front made very nice progress over the past year with a lot of Linux kernel and toolchain improvements, new targets being enabled, and new instructions being supported along with other additions for improving the overall RISC-V software ecosystem. When it comes to hardware though most of the readily available RISC-V systems are painstakingly slow and the more performant/featureful options are much harder to come by...
articles.title: RISC-V Made Nice Software Progress In 2024 While Interesting Hardware Still Rare

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Arch Linux project appears to have enjoyed a rather robust and successful 2024 with Valve continuing to make use of it as a base for their SteamOS distribution and now engaging more with upstream Arch Linux. Downstreams like CachyOS, Manjaro, and EndeavourOS continue to make it an appealing choice for enthusiasts and gamers. And then the continued improvements to Archinstall for an easy-to-use and quick installer and other enhancements overall made for a well-rounded year...
articles.title: Arch Linux Had A Great Year With Valve's Continued Backing, EndeavourOS & CachyOS Boost

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With New Year's Eve at Phoronix it means combing through Git statistics for the past year of various open-source projects among other end of year coverage... The most surprising takeaway from today's end of year exploration was seeing the Linux kernel hitting a decade low for the number of new commits this year. But not all is bad as on a line count the annual metric is comparable to more recent years...
articles.title: The Linux Kernel Hit A Decade Low In 2024 For The Number Of New Commits Per Year

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In working toward the Debian 13 "Trixie" stable release in 2025, as a lovely New Year's Eve surprise today is the first alpha release of the Debian Installer for Trixie...
articles.title: Debian Installer Trixie Alpha 1 Brings RISC-V & Drops i386 Installer

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the unexpected twists this year was after several years of AMD quietly funding the ZLUDA developer for enabling unmodified CUDA applications to run on AMD GPUs at near-native performance, the ZLUDA atop AMD HIP code was made available and open-source following the end of the AMD contract. But then later on that ZLUDA code was taken down at the request of AMD. Back in October ZLUDA then decided to pursue a new life as an open-source multi-GPU CUDA implementation with an emphasis on AI workloads. Now as a New Year's Eve surprise, ZLUDA v4 was released as the first step to that new codebase...
articles.title: ZLUDA v4 Released For Initial CUDA Support On Non-NVIDIA GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Samsung ARM device updates are in the process of being queued up to the SoC tree ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.14 merge window in January...
articles.title: Samsung Galaxy S20 & S9 With Exynos 9810 Support Coming To Linux 6.14

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: This year was another interesting year for Microsoft with continuing to make more of their software projects open-source, adding more Unix/Linux-like features to Windows, continuing to advance Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), keeping up with maintenance on their Azure Linux distribution, and other unexpected open-source/Linux surprises...
articles.title: Microsoft Continued With Many Linux & Open-Source Announcements In 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It was a mighty fine year for the Wayland ecosystem on the Linux desktop with KDE Plasma 6 having brought much more polished Wayland support and now at parity to its X11 session, the NVIDIA driver stack seeing much better Wayland support with its latest drivers, LXQt and Xfce and others working more on Wayland support, and the continued climb of various innovative Wayland compositors...
articles.title: Wayland's Wild 2024 With Better KDE Plasma Support, NVIDIA Maturity & More Desktops

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Right before Christmas Meta engineer Rik van Riel posted Linux kernel patches to make use of the AMD INVLPGB instruction for broadcast TLB invalidation. INVLPGB is present in AMD Ryzen and EPYC processors since Zen 3 and early data showed by Rik indicated nice improvement. A third iteration of those patches have already been posted as this AMD INLVPGB usage works its way to the mainline kernel...
articles.title: AMD INVLPGB Linux Patches Updated For Broadcast TLB Invalidation

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Mesa 3D graphics drivers saw many new features and improvements land in 2024, on a Git commit basis it's actually at a several year low in terms of new commits. Here are the numbers as well as a look at the most active contributors to Mesa, including a Valve open-source graphics driver developer now taking the top spot...
articles.title: Mesa Saw Fewer Patches This Year But Valve's Contributions Took The Top Spot

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in early 2023 an Xtensa back-end was added to LLVM for the Cadence Tensilica Xtensa IP. Xtensa is used for DSPs, micro-controllers, and this 32-bit RISC architecture is also used for other hardware like data processing engines.  Two years after the LLVM back-end was introduced, the Clang C/C++ compiler has added Xtensa target support...
articles.title: Clang 20 Compiler Adds Support For Xtensa CPU Target

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While predominantly covering Linux-related news and Linux benchmarking at Phoronix, the BSDs hold a special spot. Here's a look back at some of the most exciting BSD milestones and FreeBSD / NetBSD / OpenBSD / DragonFlyBSD project news of 2024...
articles.title: FreeBSD Collaborating With AMD, NetBSD 10.0 Release & Other BSD Highlights Of 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to all the GNOME advancements and KDE excitement with shipping Plasma 6 this year, other alternative open-source desktop environments enjoyed much success too this year... System76's Rust-based COSMIC desktop environment for their Pop!_OS Linux distribution reached alpha form, Xfce 4.20 released earlier this month, LXQt 2.0 and 2.1 debuted, and other improvements too...
articles.title: Xfce 4.20, COSMIC Alpha & LXQt 2 Led Alternative Open-Source Desktops In 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Tvrtko Ursulin with Igalia sent out a "request for comments" patch series today working on a deadline scheduling policy for the DRM scheduler that is used across different Direct Rendering Manager kernel graphics drivers...
articles.title: Deadline Scheduling Policy Being Experimented With For Linux Graphics Drivers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of my end-of-year benchmarking and various historical comparisons, over the holidays I was curious to take a look at how the mature AMD EPYC 9004 "Genoa" performance has evolved over the past two years under Linux. Going off benchmarks I ran back at the end of 2022 on the same AMD Titanite EPYC reference server platform for two EPYC 9654 Genoa processors, I repeated the same tests using the newest releases of Intel Clear Linux and Ubuntu Linux for seeing how the performance has evolved.
articles.title: Intel's Linux Performance Optimizations Continue Paying Off For AMD EPYC

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Cloudflare is ending 2024 by announcing a new open-source project: h3i for low-level HTTP/3 testing and debugging...
articles.title: Cloudflare Makes Open-Source h3i For HTTP/3 Testing & Debugging

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The open-source Mesa 3D graphics driver had a rather great year with a number of performance optimizations landing, on-time support for Intel Lunar Lake and Battlemage Xe2 graphics, early AMD RDNA4 support, multiple drivers having same-day Vulkan 1.4 support, the continued progress of the open-source NVIDIA NVK Vulkan driver, and much more thanks to the contributions of Intel, AMD, Valve, and other organizations -- even Microsoft's continued merge requests!..
articles.title: Mesa's Terrific Year With Better Vulkan Ray-Tracing, NVK Progress & Same-Day Vulkan 1.4

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As a very interesting end-of-year change for Mesa 25.0, AMD is now using the ACO compiler by default for pre-GFX10 (before RDNA / Navi) GPUs with the RadeonSI Gallium3D driver...
articles.title: RadeonSI Driver Now Uses ACO By Default For Pre-RDNA GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week Ikey Doherty's Serpent OS Linux distribution debuted in alpha form while kicking off the new week is updated install media to provide a few fixes for this original from-scratch Linux distribution...
articles.title: Updated Serpent OS Alpha Brings Few Fixes To This Original Linux Distribution

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last weekend a Meta engineer posted Linux kernel patches to make use of the AMD INVLPGB instruction for broadcast TLB invalidation. The Linux kernel can in turn invalidate TLB entries on remote CPUs without needing to send IPIs and without having to wait for remote CPUs to handle those interrupts. Synthetic benchmarks shown in that patch series were very promising and thus I carried out some benchmarking over the holidays of this AMD INVLPGB support for the Linux kernel.
articles.title: Benchmarking The AMD INVLPGB Linux Kernel Patches For Better Performance
Skew-T Log-P
Time Capsule Instructions
Lasering Incidents
Sun Avoidance

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Inverted Spear of Heaven is one of the more useful weapons you can yield in Jujutsu Infinite, but to do so, you'll have to add it to your inventory first.


There are several ways to improve your character, such as equipping yourself with good gear that you can obtain from your grind. Some of them are good, and others not so, and the Inverted Spear of Heaven definitely falls among the first. It's a Unique and versatile weapon that can be useful in both PvP and PvE, so let's take a look at how to obtain it inside the game.


Best ways to obtain the Inverted Spear of Heaven in Jujutsu Infinite


Obtaining the Inverted Spear of Heaven is slightly more manageable in Jujutsu Infinite as it's not a Special Grade tier item. Still, you'll have to largely rely on your luck, but less so than you…
articles.title: How to get Inverted Spear of Heaven in Jujutsu Infinite

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Not many hours are left for the NumeroFUT promo to go live in EA FC 25, and the first set of leaks have hinted at the special cards coming soon to Ultimate Team.


NumeroFUT will be a new addition to Ultimate Team as this campaign hasn't been seen in older Ultimate Teams. Naturally, there's plenty of reasons to be excited, but EA Sports has remained tight-lipped about the promo cards as of writing. Only the release date has been confirmed, and if you're looking to find out more about the cards, you'll need to rely on the social media leaks and rumors. 


Complete list of EA FC 25 NumeroFUT promo players


Unlike Winter Wildcards, NumeroFUT won't be having any special set of Heroes and Icons. It will only include promo cards for active footballers, and a few big names have already been leaked. 



Rafael Leao


Robert Lewandowski


James Maddison


Eduardo Camavinga


Jonathan Tah


James Rodriguez


Pedro Neto


Dusan Vlahovic


Leon Goretzka



More names are expected to be added as the release date gets closer. Once we have more leaks, the names will be added to this list. James Rodriguez could be an interesting addition since he's been reintroduced to Ultimate Team only recently. Just like Juan Mata and David De Gea, we could get this first special card during the upcoming campaign.


NumeroFUT will go live on Friday, January 3, at 6 p.m. UK time when the special cards will be added to the packs. A few items are also expected to be released via SBCs and objectives, so make sure to be on the lookout for those. Additionally, Season 4 rewards also feature a few NumeroFUT items with Marco Asensio available as early as level 11. That's a great way to stack your club with a few promo items for free. 

The post All EA FC 25 NumeroFUT promo player leaks appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: All EA FC 25 NumeroFUT promo player leaks

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Starseed: Asnia Trigger is the latest addition to the world of gacha titles, and the opening week has seen the introduction of some really interesting characters.


As with any gacha, you'll want to focus on getting a strong start, and that means selecting units that are relatively overpowered in the early days. Doing so will help you clear out all the content quicker and earn more rewards in the process. During the opening week, I felt that the overall balance of the characters was decent, but some of them clearly stood out.


Starseed: Asnia Trigger tier list


To rank the characters, I have used four different tiers. While the SSR units are clearly better, you shouldn't sleep on some of the more commonly available girls as well.



S-tier: Absolutely broken units in the current meta.


…
articles.title: Starseed: Asnia Trigger tier list of best units (January 2025)

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
In NBA 2K25, the answers to 2KTV episodes can be a steady source of some great rewards to help your cause in modes like MyTeam and MyCareer. 


So far, sixteen episodes have been launched, and they include questions associated with the game and basketball in general. Solving the questions and choosing the right answers will help you get different in-game rewards. 


NBA 2K25 2KTV episode one answers


Here's the complete list of all 13 questions you will come across in the first episode, along with all the answers. 


Question
Answer




NBA 2K25 features our _ season?

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Egg of the King is a vital resource to find, and doing so will allow you to upgrade Griffin in Anime Adventures.


This particular item is tied closely to the Eggs of Sacrifice that you can earn via different in-game activities. To evolve Griffin, you'll need Periapt of the King to access him first. Let's take a look at how to get this item in the first place.


How to get Egg of the King in Anime Adventures


So far, the only known way to find Egg of the King is by using a Summoning Circle. The odds will be low as it's a Mythic item. Odds-wise, you can obtain it from any available banners, but the Special one will have better chances with a 2x Mythic boost. Do note that it's a matter of luck, and you may require a lot of diamonds to make the rolls.


Unfortunately, there's no sure-shot way to obtain this item, which would certainly have been nice. Nevertheless, the item isn't tied to a time-limited event, so you can have your fair share of tries even if initially unsuccessful.




How to use the Periapt of the King in Anime Adventures


As I said earlier, the Periapt of the King is closely associated with the Eggs of Sacrifice that you can find in Anime Adventures. The Egg of the King will be available in your items stash, and you can also search for it using its name. Once you select the item and decide to use it, a red portal will open, leading you to the Griffin NPC location. From there, you can use the Eggs of Sacrifice to evolve him.


If you're unsure how to get Eggs of Sacrifice, check this guide out. As with Egg of the King, the Eggs of Sacrifice will also require concentrated efforts and a long time to find. You can also sacrifice Mythic items to quicken the process, but you'll lose those units permanently.

The post Anime Adventures Periapt of the King guide: How to get Egg of the King appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Anime Adventures Periapt of the King guide: How to get Egg of the King

articles.description:
Completing the Periapt of Sacrifice should be a top priority if you want mighty units in Anime Adventures. Doing so will help you get the Eggs of Sacrifice, which will be necessary as you upgrade your units.


Let's take a look at how you can farm the Periapt of Sacrifice and gain the eggs in a consistent fashion.


Best way to farm Sacrifice Eggs in Anime Adventures


The most consistent way to get the Eggs of Sacrifice is by using Eclipse Portals. These portals can be acquired from the Snow Kingdom Infinite mode. While the mode can be difficult for beginners, completing it won't be an issue if you have units over level 100.


To make the most out of your urns, try to host the Eclipse Portals, as it will increase your final rewards. However, you can also join runs set up by other players, although the rewards will get lower. If the Eclipse Portal runs feel difficult, you can play with your friends or other players, making it easier to survive all the waves.


Additionally, speak with Zen to get a daily quest for seven Periapts of Sacrifice. To complete the mission, kill the demons that spawn in Eclipse Portals and Snow Kingdom Infinite mode.




How to use Eggs of Sacrifice in Anime Adventures


Once you complete a run, you'll get a random amount of Periapts of Sacrifice. The number of eggs you get for hosting a run will always be higher. You'll have to teleport to the special area of Griffin NPC to use the eggs. To do so, you'll need the Periapt of the King.


To evolve, you'll need around 200 eggs as each one progresses your Ascension by 0.5%. You can also sacrifice Mythical units that you don't need to quicken the process. Sacrificing evolved Mythical units will provide the best progression, but you'll lose the units permanently.

The post Anime Adventures Periapt of Sacrifice guide: How to get Eggs of Sacrifice appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Anime Adventures Periapt of Sacrifice guide: How to get Eggs of Sacrifice

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
There are many ways to power up in Jujutsu Infinite, and promoting your character after a certain point becomes necessary.


A dedicated ranking system is in place, which allows you to take your abilities to the next level. However, this system is slightly different in terms of how it works. Let's take a look at how you can promote your character, along with the resources you will need.


How to rank up in Jujutsu Infinite


The process begins by completing as many quests or missions as you can. Completing them will earn you various rewards and EXP. The amount of EXP you get varies based on the nature and difficulty of quests, but completing them will help you grow your in-game character.


When you begin this process, you'll have the rank of "Non-Sorcerer." Once you reach level 60, you can talk with the Clan Head NPC to rank yourself up. There are five different ranks (or, as the game calls it, Grades), and you'll need certain resources besides being at the necessary player levels. Once you fulfill the requirements and have the necessary resources, interacting with the Clan Head NPC will allow you to rank up.


All promotion levels in Jujutsu Infinite


The following table details all the prerequisites applicable for the five rank-up levels.


Grade
Requirements




Grade 4
Reach Level 60
Collect 25 Mission Essence
$5,000


Grade 3
Reach Level 120
Collect 50 Mission Essence
$50,000


Grade 2
Reach Level 180
Collect 100 Mission Essence
$100,000


Grade 1
Reach Level 240
Collect 150 Mission Essence
$250,000


Special Grade
Reach Level 300
Collect 200 Mission Essence
$500,000






Apart from in-game credits and EXP, you'll also need to get a lot of Mission Essence. The requirements go up as you reach higher ranks, and here is our guide on the best ways to farm Mission Essence. Doing so will always keep you ready for the next rank as soon as your player level meets the requirements. 

The post How to promote in Jujutsu Infinite appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to promote in Jujutsu Infinite

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Dragon Tokens have confused many Blox Fruits players since they randomly got added to the account of certain players, but it has their use inside the game.


Incidentally, the mysterious item wasn't available in the account of every player. Instead, it got added to the accounts of those who have been Blox Fruits for some time now and had downloaded Update 24 before the developers pulled back. As I said, this item has certain uses inside the game, so let's understand how it works.


How to get Dragon Tokens in Blox Fruits


Update 24 introduced several new things to Blox Fruits, which included an updated version of the Dragon Fruit. Unfortunately, the update was pulled back by the developers, and players who had the Dragon Fruit lost access to it. To compensate the players, they were handed something called a Dragon Token.


Again, this token is of two types. Players having a non-permanent or physical version of the Dragon Fruit were provided with a regular Dragon Token. Those who had a permanent Dragon Fruit were provided with a Permanent Dragon Token.


Incidentally, the price of Dragon Fruit has been raised from 4,000 Robux to 5,000 following the implementation of Update 24.




How to use Dragon Tokens in Blox Fruits


The use of a Dragon Token mostly depends on the type you have. If you have a permanent Dragon Token, you can use it to obtain a permanent East or West Dragon Fruit. The version will be completely randomized, but it's a great return since you're getting an upgraded version of the Dragon Fruit.


If you received a non-permanent Dragon Token, you can use it to get a non-permanent East or West Dragon Fruit. Again, the final item you get will be completely randomized. If you end up getting a duplicate Dragon Fruit in your inventory, it will be automatically changed to a Mythical Fruit.

The post How do Dragon Tokens work in Blox Fruits appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How do Dragon Tokens work in Blox Fruits

articles.description:
It's time to celebrate the end of 2024 and the start of a new year with a beautiful outfit in Dress to Impress. The Sparkling Resolution outfit features a dress, necklace, and sleeves but is only available until January 2, 2025.


How to get the Sparkling Resolution outfit in Dress to Impress


The Sparkling Resolution outfit is a limited-time set available in the Dress to Impress clothing shop for $6,000 in-game cash or the equivalent of 1,500 Robux. You can buy the set's individual pieces or all three items at once starting from December 30 until the event's end date, January 2, 2025.


Screenshot by Destructoid


You can view the Sparkling Resolution outfit by selecting the shoe and lipstick button on the left side of your screen and navigating to the dress button.


You have the option to buy each of the three items separately or all at once if you have enough cash. Below is the cost of every Sparkling Resolution piece:



Sparkling Dress: $4,500


Sparkling Sleeve: $1,000


Sparkling Necklace: $500



Purchasing all three pieces costs $6,000 in-game money, making it not only possible to acquire without spending real money but making it cheaper than sets like Myra the Magical Girl. However, it's only available until January 2, giving you just a few days to get your hands on this exclusive outfit. 


It doesn't come with a hairstyle or makeup, though, so you may have to use a few Dress to Impress codes to complete the set.


Like other outfits in Dress to Impress, you can customize the Sparkling Resolution set to match your current theme. Depending on the theme, you may have to change it to other common colors like white, black, red, or a mix of several hues. Similarly, if you're not a fan of purple and want to try something new, you can experiment with various patterns and see what sticks.

The post How to unlock the New Years outfit in Dress to Impress appeared first on Destructoid.

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In 2022, a group of Israel-based TV companies obtained a court order in the U.S. It compelled every ISP in the country to block three resilient pirate sites that blocking in Israel had failed to stop. Intervention by Cloudflare ended that dream and 2.5 years later, despite other measures targeting the sites, it appears that at least one is still going strong. The TV companies are now taking legal action against UK ISPs; they're unlikely to put up a fight, they may not even turn up in court.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TV Group Couldn’t Force U.S. ISPs to Block Pirates, UK ISPs May Offer Help

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italy launched its ambitious "Piracy Shield" platform in early 2024, hoping to finally curb the rampant piracy of live sports events. Throughout the year, the system has primarily targeted the domains and IP addresses used by pirate IPTV providers to stream illegal content. Official data made available to the public is limited but with help from data provided by an anonymous source, we can identify key trends from a very controversial year.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Piracy Shield: Top 10 Countries Blocked For Hosting IPTV Pirates in 2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Anti-piracy coalition ACE wraps up a transformative and successful year. Despite major shifts in leadership, the MPA-backed coalition of media companies secured key victories, including the high-profile takedown of the Fmovies piracy network.  ACE also reported a number of other successes and has already set its sights on new 'pirate' targets for the coming year.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ACE Wraps Up Transformative Year with a Fresh List of Pirate Site Targets

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Link-Busters is the unofficial DMCA takedown champion of 2024. The anti-piracy outfit works for many of the world's largest publishing companies and is currently flagging the majority of all 'pirate' URLs to Google search; more than two billion in total. Despite this stellar effort, book pirates are chalking up new records too. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: More Than Half of All Google Search Takedowns Now Come from Link-Busters

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
For the past several years, the recording industry has branded stream-ripping services the leading piracy threat. On the near horizon, the industry claims that the rise of generative AI presents a new and rapidly evolving challenge for the music ecosystem that threatens its long-term sustainability. According to global industry group IFPI, stream-ripping is likely fueling this secondary threat.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: IFPI: Stream-Ripping Fuels Generative AI From Which Existential Threats Emerge

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Gladiator II' tops the chart, followed by 'The Order'. 'Venom: The Last Dance' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 12/30/2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The final verdict in a Danish site blocking battle, involving LaLiga and Rojadirecta, confirms that live sports broadcasts are protected copyright works. This marks a significant victory for rightsholders, who believe that this landmark decision paves the way for increased blocking of pirate streaming services across Europe. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Danish Court Greenlights Copyright Protection for Live Sports in Landmark Blocking Case

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
According to a phrase popularized by Carl Sagan, extraordinary claims should be supported by extraordinary evidence. A new piracy scare story published on Sunday takes a different approach. The extraordinary claim is that fake IPTV portals run by law enforcement are entrapping "ordinary users" to obtain evidence of their crimes. Supported by exactly zero evidence, the report claims that hundreds of internet users have already been identified.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bogus Pirate IPTV Portals Run By Law Enforcement “Entrap Hundreds”

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
'House of the Dragon' is the most-pirated TV show released on torrent sites in 2024. The popular 'Game of Thrones' prequel replaces 'The Last of Us', which topped the chart last year. Amazon's 'The Boys' takes the second spot at a respectable distance, while Disney's Shōgun is the hottest newcomer.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Is The Most Pirated TV Show of 2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In a landmark ruling, the Court of Milan has ordered Cloudflare to block pirate streaming services that offer Serie A football matches. The court found that Cloudflare's services are instrumental in facilitating access to live pirate streams, undermining Italy's 'Piracy Shield' legislation. The order, which applies in Italy, affects Cloudflare's CDN, DNS resolver, WARP and proxy services. It also includes a broad data disclosure section. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cloudflare Must Block ‘Piracy Shield’ Domains and IP Addresses Across its Service

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Around 2016, sports streaming site Rojadirecta closed its doors to visitors from Spain after losing its legal battle with Mediapro. Despite the win, the broadcaster was disappointed that the court had found the company behind Rojadirecta liable, but not company owner Igor Seoane. After the Supreme Court held that Seoane could be held liable, last Friday a court confirmed total damages of $33 million, with Seoane and the company jointly liable for half of that amount.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Rojadirecta & Site Operator Hit With $33m Piracy Damages Judgment

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Once-thriving Usenet provider NSE was targeted by Dutch anti-piracy group BREIN many years ago. Under legal pressure, the provider felt forced to shut down its successful business. Though NSE ultimately triumphed in court, that victory came years later. NSE is now demanding millions of euros to compensate for the alleged damage to its business. BREIN, however, sees things differently. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Destroyed’ Usenet Provider Sues Anti-Piracy Group for Millions in Damages

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular shadow library LibGen continues to face trouble. In addition to ongoing technical problems, a U.S. lawsuit resulted in several domain suspensions and seizures in recent weeks. To top it off, the shadow library was just added to Germany's pirate site blocking list, making it harder to access the remaining domains.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Domain Seizures and German ISP Blockade Add to Libgen’s Troubles

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Sixteen well-known suppliers active in the UK pirate IPTV market have been selected by broadcaster Sky to star in a new phase of the company's ISP blocking program. A new order obtained at the High Court is technically an extension of an existing order won last year. However, with significant tweaks, upgrades and an extremely determined opponent, pirates may be about to face their toughest challenge yet.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sky’s Enhanced High Court Pirate IPTV Blocking Order Closes Loopholes

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The easiest way to hurt a pirate site, at least temporarily, is by taking away its domain name. Historically, domain name registries have been hesitant to take action but with the right approach, progress can be made. This week, anti-piracy group BREIN reported that following their complaints, the .nl and .eu registries took action against several 'pirate' domains. On closer inspection, it appears that copyright has little to do with it.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: EU and NL Domain Registries Take Down Piracy-Linked Domains

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Coordinated by Italy last month, a huge law enforcement operation reportedly 'dismantled' a pirate IPTV service with 22 million users. That's an extraordinary number and shows why countries like Italy have adopted mass site blocking measures. Logic suggests that the removal of such a huge player from the market might reduce the need for blocking measures, if only temporarily. The data shows that in the wake of the action, blocking demands significantly increased.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Dismantling a 22m User Pirate IPTV Service Led to Big Rise in ISP Blocking

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Two decades ago, the torrenting world lost a legend: Suprnova.org. This pioneering file-sharing site, once a hub for millions of users, was abruptly shut down on December 19th, 2004. Today, we revisit the Suprnova story and speak with the site's founder about its lasting impact and the YouTube empire he built in recent years.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Suprnova’s Founder Speaks: 20 Years, Many Lessons, and a YouTube Empire

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italians who simply view pirate IPTV via illicit subscriptions have been warned for months that their activities could be reported to the judicial authorities for potential prosecution. As part of an investigation into a pirate IPTV subscription seller, a total of 23 people have appeared in court in recent months for simply buying a pirate package. Judges in two separate proceedings have now acquitted all 23 after concluding that this type of piracy isn't actually a crime.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Judges Acquit a Total of 23 Pirate IPTV Subscribers: Personal Use is Not a Crime

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Federal Court of Canada has issued a new site blocking order requiring major ISPs to block access to Soap2Day domains. The order was issued in response to a lawsuit filed by Netflix, Bell, and several major Hollywood studios alleging copyright infringement.  The operators of the associated Soap2Day domains must pay millions of Canadian dollars in damages. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Netflix and Hollywood Obtain Canadian Site Blocking Order Against Pirate ‘Brand’ Soap2Day

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (criezy)

articles.description: Ho, ho, ho, Santa is in town. And he’s brought a gift with him. Here’s a shiny new package for you to unwrap, containing the first beta version of the upcoming OpenTTD 15 release. It comes faster, with road waypoints, fewer passwords, better scenario editor, and hopefully with a lot less bugs. To be a bit less vague, here are some of the highlights: Improved picker windows for stations/waypoints/objects/and more. Oh, and that does include road waypoints. Better perfomance in various places, including faster path signals that are now green by default. Password-less network authentication using keys. Several improvements for NewGRFs regarding cargo support. Better scenario editor with a town data importer and manual house placement. A large tree fully hung with ornamental bugfixes. Sadly though, not everbody was good this year. The old NPF pathfinder was finally retired, after YAPF being the superior default for many, many years now. There’s a lot of bugs left for you to find, though, guaranteed. Enjoy the beta, test all the things and report anything you find amiss, to make OpenTTD 15 the best OpenTTD 15 ever. Download Changelog Bug tracker
articles.title: OpenTTD 15.0-beta1

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Z dosavadních Eggersových filmů je tento nejméně autorský, nejméně konzistentní a nejvíce působí jako kdyby do jeho vzniku někdo kecal ohledně jeho komerčního potenciálu. Výsledek je tudíž poněkud schizofrenní, chvíli artový, chvíli komerční, a nepříjemně rozvleklý. (Ilča 70 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Nosferatu - 60 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Učebnicový příklad toho, jak někdo viděl fungující originál ("Sentimental", Španělsko 2020) a natočil jeho český "srandovnější" remake, aniž by chápal proč a jak ten originál fungoval. (Ilča 30 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: V dobrém i zlém - 20 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: "Bohužel" tento film není tak špatný, aby byl zábavný. Je to jen nuda, která není vůbec ničím zajímavá. Takhle nějak si představuji, že budou vypadat stoprocentně AI generované filmy. Nejzajímavější a nejzábavnější je malá role Russella Crowea.  (Ilča 40 %)
articles.title: Audio recenze: Lovec Kraven [Kraven The Hunter] - 40 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Někdo napsal scénář s cool zápletkami a dialogy, někdo vymodeloval úžasná prostředí, někdo složil hudbu a nahrál dialogy skoro jako John Williams a Harrison Ford... To všechno funguje velmi dobře. Ale je to proloženo otravnou hrou, kde pořádně nefunguje boj, stealth ani puzzly, a jejíž interaktivita zdržuje od toho cool příběhu.
articles.title: Skororecenze: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description:
Za pár dní má v našich kinech (a po celém světě) premiéru "remasterovaná verze" kultovní animované podívané Interstella 5555. A je důležité říct si něco o tom, o jakou podívanou vlastně jde a v čem přesně spočívá ten "remaster".
U zrodu tohoto počinu stálo elektronické hudební duo Daft Punk, které v roce 2001 vydalo své album "Discovery". K písničkám z alba vyšly animované videoklipy, které produkoval Leidži Macumoto, což byl kultovní japonský výtvarník (zemřel loni), který měl na svém kontě mnoho animovaných seriálů, především ze 70. - 80. let (nejslavnější z nich byl asi "Space Battleship Yamato"). Daft Punk ho oslovili proto, že na jeho seriálech vyrůstali, takže výsledné dílo, včetně "jednodušší" retro animace a naivní zápletky zcela záměrně připomíná staré japonské televizní počiny (n…
articles.title: Recenze: Daft Punk & Leiji Matsumoto's Interstella 5555 - 70 %

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Unknown)
articles.description: Pokud zbožňujete stejnojmenný divadelní muzikál, funguje tento film pravděpodobně velmi dobře. Pokud ho vůbec neznáte, budete ve výrazné nevýhodě, a to z vícero důvodů. Přestože mám muzikály rád, téměř vůbec se u mě nedostavil jakýkoliv pocit dojetí nebo jiná silná emoce a z písniček si téměř nic nepamatuji. Což je bizarní, protože zbožňuji písničky v "Princi egyptském", kterého napsal stejný autor pár let před "Čarodějkou". - Ilča 50 %
articles.title: Audio recenze: Čarodějka [Wicked - Part 1] - 70 %
